Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is grey in section, interior surface has flaked away in places revealing the core, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and with faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying contents as year 10 wine.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 52
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393165) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393165)
